intro: Friesodielsia cuneiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed fern, is a unique member of the Polypodiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are typically less than 30 cm in length. The plant produces small, spore-bearing structures called sori on the underside of its leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
